page.title: 10Roads and railways, S. Fylde
page.content:
{Roads} The{M55 motorway,}opened in 1975, links the M6 with Blackpool.
The only other major road is the{A583 Preston-Blackpool road,}which passes through the village of Little Plumpton. { {Railways} The Preston-Fleetwood line was{ extended from Poulton to{Blackpool {North}in 1846. At the same time the Preston to{Blackpool South}line, which passes through Lytham St Annes, was opened. The{Blackpool Central}line opened to cater for holiday traffic in 1899, but was closed in l965.
{ A railbus}will operate on the Blackpool South line from May l986, carrying 122 seated passengers.
